definitions.definition: (Old English law) To make a tender of; to offer or tender.
(followed by a to-infinitive) To be likely, or probable to do something, or to have a certain habit or leaning.
definitions.example: It tends to snow here in winter.

definitions.definition: To contribute to or toward some outcome.
(with to) To look after (e.g. an ill person.)
definitions.example: We need to tend to the garden, which has become a mess.

definitions.definition: To accompany as an assistant or protector; to care for the wants of; to look after; to watch; to guard.
To wait (upon), as attendants or servants; to serve; to attend.
To be attentive to; to note carefully; to attend to.
To manage (an anchored vessel) when the tide turns, to prevent it from entangling the cable when swinging.
To kindle; ignite; set on fire; light; inflame; burn.
